name: A Perfect Circle
logoCredits: By Michael John Stinsman - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=15811084
bio: A Perfect Circle is an American rock supergroup formed in 1999 by guitarist Billy Howerdel and Tool vocalist Maynard James Keenan. A Perfect Circle has released four studio albums, the first three during the early 2000s: Mer de Noms, their debut album in 2000, and followed up by Thirteenth Step in 2003; then in 2004, Emotive—an album of radically re-worked cover songs. Shortly after Emotive's release, the band went on hiatus; Keenan returned to Tool and started up solo work under the band name Puscifer. and Howerdel released a solo album, Keep Telling Myself It's Alright, under the moniker Ashes Divide. Band activity was sporadic in the following years; the band reformed in 2010, and played live shows on and off between 2010 and 2013, but fell into inactivity after the release of their greatest hits album, Three Sixty, and a live album box set, A Perfect Circle Live: Featuring Stone and Echo in late 2013. The band reformed in 2017 to record a fourth album, Eat the Elephant, which was released on April 20, 2018.

name: Tool
logoCredits: By Shisma 11:13, 11 August 2013 (UTC) - Vectorised by Shisma. Originally appeared on the Album 10.000 Days in 2006, Public Domain, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=27660583
bio: Tool is an American rock band from Los Angeles. Formed in 1990, the group's line-up includes drummer Danny Carey, guitarist Adam Jones, and vocalist Maynard James Keenan. Justin Chancellor has been the band's bassist since 1995, replacing their original bassist Paul D'Amour. Tool has won four Grammy Awards, performed worldwide tours, and produced albums topping the charts in several countries.

name: Terminalist
bio: Hyperthrashers based in Copenhagen, Denmark with sci-fi-fueled lyrics revolving around dromology. Debut album 'The Great Acceleration' out May 7th 2021 on vinyl, tape and digital formats via Indisciplinarian.

name: Led Zeppelin
logoCredits: By (CC BY-SA 2.0) - File:Jimmy Page with Robert Plant 2 - Led Zeppelin - 1977.jpgFile:John Bonham 1975.jpgFile:JohnPaulJones1980-2.jpg, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=16751084
bio: Led Zeppelin were an English rock band formed in London in 1968. The group consisted of Robert Plant (Vocal), Jimmy Page (Guitar), John Paul Jones (Bass, Keyboard) and John Bonham (Drums). The band's heavy, guitar-driven sound, rooted in blues and psychedelia on their early albums, has earned them recognition as one of the progenitors of heavy metal. They achieved significant commercial success with albums such as Led Zeppelin (1969), Led Zeppelin II (1969), Led Zeppelin III (1970), Led Zeppelin IV (1971), Houses of the Holy (1973), and Physical Graffiti (1975). Their song ‘Stairway to Heaven’ is among the most popular and influential rock music of all time.Led Zeppelin are widely considered one of the most successful, innovative, and influential rock groups in history.They are one of the best - selling music artists in the history of audio recording;various sources estimate the group 's record sales at 200 to 300 million units worldwide. With RIAA-certified sales of 111.5 million units, they are the second-best-selling band in the United States. They were inducted into the Rock Hall of Fame in 1995.

name: The Beatles
bio: The Beatles were an English rock band formed in Liverpool in 1960. The members consisted of John Lennon, Paul McCartney, George Harrison and Ringo Starr. They were soon known as the foremost and most influential act of rock era. Rooted in skiffle, beat, and 1950s rock and roll, the Beatles later experimented with several genres, ranging from pop ballads and Indian music to psychedelia and hard rock, often incorporating classical elements in innovative ways.The Beatles produced what many consider their finest material, from 1965 onwards including the innovative and widely influential albums Rubber Soul(1965), Revolver(1966), Sgt.Pepper 's Lonely Hearts Club Band (1967), The Beatles (commonly known as the White Album, 1968) and Abbey Road (1969).According to the RIAA, the Beatles are the best - selling music artists in the United States, with 178 million certified units.They have received ten Grammy Awards, an Academy Award for Best Original Song Score and fifteen Ivor Novello Awards.They were inducted into the Rock and Roll and Roll Hall of Fame in 1988.

name: Pink Floyd
bio: Pink Floyd were an English rock band formed in London. They achieved international acclaim with their progressive and psychedelic music. The band consisted of 5 members - David Gilmour, Syd Barrett, Nick Mason, Roger Waters, and Richard Wright.Their critically and commercially successful albums are The Dark Side of the Moon(1973), Wish You Were Here(1975), Animals(1977), The Wall(1979) and The Final Cut(1983).The Dark Side of the Moon is also considered as one of the best albums of all time.Pink Floyd were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1996.

name: Queen
logoCredits: By Images by Eddie, Thomas Steffan, Compadre Edua'h and Carl Lender. Compilation by KPFC based on the idea of Fronteira. - {{Cc-by-sa-2.0}} by Eddie{{Cc-by-sa-2.5}} by Thomas Steffan{{PD-self}} by Compadre Edua'h{{Cc-by-sa-3.0}} by Carl Lender{{Cc-by-sa-4.0}} by Fronteira, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=49368871
bio: Queen are a British rock group formed in 1970. Members were Freddie Mercury (Vocals and Piano), Brian May (Guitar, Vocals), Roger Taylor (Drums, Vocals), and John Deacon (Bass Guitar, Vocals). Before forming into Queen, Brian May and Roger Taylor had played together in a band named Smile. Freddie Mercury was a fan of Smile and encouraged them to experiment with more elaborate stage and recording techniques. He then joined the band in 1970, suggested 'Queen ' as a new band name, and adopted his familiar stage name. John Deacon was also recruited to complete the line-up.Their release of the album 'A Night at the Opera' in 1975, brought them international success.They entered the mainstream with the album 's track 'Bohemian Rhapsody', which stayed at number one in the UK for nine weeks and popularised the music video. Their 1977 album, News of the World, contained 'We Will Rock You' and 'We Are the Champions', which also have become anthems at sporting events. In 1991, while embracing their success and their fans, Mercury died of bronchopneumonia, an AIDS-related disease. Deacon then retired in 1997. After that, both Brian May and Roger Taylor returned to the state of Smile band, although they kept the 'Queen' name.

name: Metallica
logoCredits: By Kreepin Deth - Own work, CC BY-SA 4.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=114881797
bio: Metallica is an American Heavy Metal band formed in 1981. The original lineup was James Hetfield (Vocalist and Rhythm guitarist) Dave Mustaine (Lead Guitar) Lars Ulrich (Drums) Ron McGovney (Bassist) The group came into mainstream from their Self-Titled album and the hit single 'Enter Sandman '.With their first two albums, Kill 'Em All and Ride The Lightning reaching underground success, their third effort, Master of Puppets has since become one of the most important heavy metal albums ever, as it became the first thrash metal album to be certified platinum. The title track has since become the band's most played song live.On September 27, 1986, bass player Cliff Burton was killed after he was thrown out of the window and crushed to death.Metallica released their first music video in 1989. The song was One from their 1988 album, ...And Justice For All.The song received heavy critical acclaim and has since become their most played song from the album.The album also saw the debut of new bassist, Jason Newsted.Their fifth album, Metallica(also known as the Black Album), took more of a mainstream approach and has since become one of the best selling albums in America, certified 16 x Platinum.The album spawned five singles, Enter Sandman, The Unforgiven, Nothing Else Matters, Wherever I May Roam and Sad But True.

name: AC/DC
logoCredits: By Imhavingfun42 - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=8385276
bio: AC/DC are an Australian hard rock band, formed in November 1973 by brothers Malcolm and Angus Young, who continued as members until Malcolm's illness and departure in 2014. Commonly referred to as a hard rock or blues rock band, they are also considered pioneers of heavy metal.

name: The Rolling Stones
logoCredits: By Jim Pietryga - https://www.iorr.org/tour15/, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=44341280
bio: The Rolling Stones are an English rock band formed in London in 1962. The first settled line-up consisted of Brian Jones (guitar, harmonica), Ian Stewart (piano), Mick Jagger (lead vocals, harmonica), Keith Richards (guitar), Bill Wyman (bass) and Charlie Watts (drums).Their best works include songs like Paint it Black , Sympathy for the Devil, Satisfication(Which ranked no.2 in The Rolling Stones Magazine’ s best songs of all time list).The Rolling Stones were inducted into the Rock and Roll Hall of Fame in 1989, and the UK Music Hall of Fame in 2004. In 2012, the band celebrated its 50 th anniversary.

name: Guns N' Roses
bio: Guns N' Roses is an American hard rock band from Los Angeles formed in 1985. The classic lineup, as signed to Geffen Records in 1986, consisted of vocalist Axl Rose, lead guitarist Slash, rhythm guitarist Izzy Stradlin, bassist Duff McKagan, and drummer Steven Adler.

name: Nirvana
logoCredits: By P.B. Rage from USA - More Kurt -- too rad, CC BY-SA 2.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=1314918
bio: Nirvana was an American grunge band that was formed in Aberdeen, Washington in 1987. Nirvana disbanded after Kurt Cobain committed suicide in 1994. The drummer of the band, David Grohl, went on to start the Foo-Fighters, an alternative rock band.The band was comprised of Kurt Cobain(Vocals, Guitar), Dave Grohl(Drums) and Krist Novoselic(Bass).Nirvana is most well - known for their album 'Nevermind' and their song 'Smells Like Teen Spirit'.The band is known for being one of the most influential bands of all time.Together with Soundgarden, Pearl Jam and Alice In Chains, the band is part of the Big 4 of Grunge.

name: The Who
logoCredits: By Jim Summaria - Contact us/Photo submission, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=5574716
bio: The Who is English hard rock band formed in London, England in 1964. The members are Roger Daltrey (lead singer), Pete Townshend (guitarist), John Entwistle (bassist), and Keith Moon (drums). The genres they were associated with happened to be rock, soft rock, hard rock, and soul rock. They are best known for their live performances and hit songs Baba O'Riley, My Generation, and Won't Get Fooled Again. Some noted achievements were their rock operas, Tommy (album), Quadrophenia (album), and A Quick One, While He's Away (song). The Who still plays today, yet sadly, Keith Moon died in 1978 due to a accidental prescription pill overdose at the age of 32. His best friend, John Entwistle, soon followed.Entwistle died of a cocaine overdose in 2002 at the age of 57. Later, Townshend was accused of buying child pornography, but was proven innocent.Overall, in the end, The Who has contained some of the most influential talent in rock history with some of the most impressive instrumental skills, and manage to be a iconic mark in rock n roll to this day.

name: Black Sabbath
bio: Black Sabbath are an English rock band, formed in Birmingham in 1968, by guitarist and main songwriter Tony Iommi, bassist and main lyricist Geezer Butler, singer Ozzy Osbourne, and drummer Bill Ward. The band have since experienced multiple line-up changes, with guitarist Iommi being the only constant presence in the band through the years. Originally formed as a blues rock band, the group soon adopted the Black Sabbath moniker and began incorporating occult themes with horror-inspired lyrics and tuned-down guitars. Despite an association with these two themes, Black Sabbath also composed songs dealing with social instability, political corruption, the dangers of drug abuse and apocalyptic prophecies of the horrors of war.

name: Raised Fist
logoCredits: By Notwist - Own work, CC BY 2.5, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=1780996
bio: Raised Fist is a Swedish hardcore punk band formed in 1993 in Luleå. It currently consists of guitarists Jimmy Tikkanen and Daniel Holmgren, bassist Andreas Johansson, vocalist Alexander Hagman and drummer Robert Wiiand.

name: Refused
logoCredits: By killua-po - Own work, CC BY-SA 3.0, https://commons.wikimedia.org/w/index.php?curid=20767071
bio: Refused (also known as the Refused) is a Swedish hardcore punk band originating from Umeå and formed in 1991. Refused is composed of vocalist Dennis Lyxzén, guitarist Kristofer Steen, drummer David Sandström, and bassist Magnus Flagge. Guitarist Jon Brännström was a member from 1994, through reunions, until he was fired in late-2014. Their lyrics are often of a non-conformist and politically far-left nature.

name: Steuber Group
bio: Steuber Group emerged from the vibrant underground scene of Berlin. Known for their electrifying performances and catchy rock anthems, they quickly gained a devoted following. Their music blends classic rock vibes with modern energy, creating a unique sound.

name: Howe Beahan and Waelchi
bio: Formed in the heart of Seattle, Howe, Beahan and Waelchi are known for their soulful lyrics and powerful melodies. Their journey began in small clubs and quickly escalated to major venues, captivating audiences with their raw, authentic rock sound.

name: Simonis Inc
bio: Simonis Inc started as a garage band in Los Angeles, gradually building a reputation for their energetic live shows and catchy tunes. Their music combines gritty rock with heartfelt lyrics, resonating with fans across generations.

name: Zboncak Haag
bio: Zboncak - Haag's enchanting folk music transports listeners to a world of storytelling and melodic beauty. Originating from the quiet countryside, their acoustic sound and poetic lyrics have captured hearts worldwide.

name: West and Sons
bio: West and Sons bring traditional folk music to life with their harmonious vocals and intricate instrumentation. Inspired by their rural roots, they infuse modern elements into classic folk, creating a refreshing yet nostalgic sound.

name: Champlin O'Hara
bio: Champlin - O'Hara, led by the enigmatic Fausto Maggio, is a one-man rock powerhouse. His deep, gritty voice and exceptional guitar skills have made him a standout performer, known for his intense and captivating solo shows.

name: Barrows Group
bio: Barrows Group brings a fierce and relentless energy to the metal scene. Hailing from Detroit, their aggressive riffs and thunderous drums have earned them a reputation for being one of the most intense live acts around.

name: Conn Group
bio: Conn Group specializes in the dramatic and emotive world of stage and screen music. Their orchestral compositions and cinematic soundscapes have been featured in numerous film and theater productions, captivating audiences worldwide.

name: Romaguera Toy
bio: Romaguera - Toy pushes the boundaries of traditional music with their avant-garde approach. Their experimental sounds and unconventional performances challenge the norms, creating a unique experience that defies categorization.

name: Luettgen Inc
bio: Luettgen Inc's brutal and unrelenting metal sound originates from the gritty streets of New York. Their dark and powerful music has garnered a dedicated fanbase, drawn to their intense performances and raw energy.

name: Ritchie Lind
bio: Ritchie - Lind's thunderous metal soundscape is defined by heavy riffs and powerful vocals. Emerging from the underground scene, they have rapidly risen to prominence with their dynamic stage presence and relentless energy.

name: Emard Dooley
bio: Emard - Dooley is a powerhouse rock band from Chicago. Their anthemic songs and captivating performances have earned them a reputation as one of the most exciting new acts in the rock scene.

name: Steuber Skiles and Wyman
bio: Steuber, Skiles and Wyman, fronted by the fierce Kelli Medhurst, delivers a powerful metal experience. Her commanding stage presence and intense vocals make each performance unforgettable, leaving audiences in awe.

name: Dooley LLC
bio: Dooley LLC, a solo rock project by Lorenz Hettinger, combines raw emotion with powerful guitar work. His heartfelt lyrics and passionate performances have resonated with fans, making him a standout artist in the rock genre.

name: McLaughlin LLC
bio: McLaughlin LLC creates mesmerizing music for stage and screen. Their dramatic compositions and emotive performances have been featured in numerous theatrical productions, captivating audiences with their powerful soundtracks.

name: Nitzsche and Harvey

name: Iron Fury
bio: Formed in a basement, their sound is raw and powerful.

name: Eternal Frost

name: Dreadful Symphony

name: Metal Fury

name: Spectral Carnage

name: Crimson Skyline

name: Raging Rampage

name: Aurora Borealis

name: Soulforge

bio: Echoes of Elysium evokes visions of paradise lost, blending classical elegance with the raw energy of Metal, creating a sonic tapestry of ethereal beauty.

name: Tempest's Fury
bio: Raging like a tempest unleashed, Tempest's Fury roars with thunderous intensity, invoking the fury

name: Soul Reaver

name: Voidwalker
bio: Voidwalker explores the vast expanse of progressive metalcore, blending technical prowess with emotional depth to traverse the realms of sonic possibility.

name: Infernal Dominion
bio: Infernal Dominion conjures dark symphonic landscapes with ferocious black metal fury, plunging listeners into the depths of infernal dominion.

bio: Neon Nightmare merges the neon-lit dystopian future with the aggression of metal, creating a cybernetic cacophony that blurs the lines between man and machine.

name: Mystic Eclipse
bio: Mystic Eclipse paints ethereal landscapes with atmospheric black metal, weaving intricate melodies and cascading rhythms that transport listeners to otherworldly realms.

name: Doombringer
bio: Doombringer delivers the crushing weight of stoner doom metal, invoking apocalyptic visions with thunderous riffs and hypnotic grooves that envelop the soul.

name: Spectral Sorrow
bio: Spectral Sorrow channels the anguish of existence into melodic death metal, blending sorrowful melodies with savage aggression to create a haunting sonic experience.

name: Lunar Eclipse
bio: Lunar Eclipse harnesses the celestial energy of progressive power metal, embarking on a cosmic journey through intricate melodies and epic anthems that illuminate the night sky.

name: Obsidian Horde
bio: Obsidian Horde unleashes a relentless barrage of crushing deathcore, combining brutal breakdowns with guttural vocals to conquer the listener's senses.

name: Celestial Ruin
bio: Celestial Ruin weaves tales of cosmic grandeur through symphonic metal, crafting majestic melodies and soaring vocals that transcend mortal limitations.

name: Venomous Eclipse
bio: Venomous Eclipse descends into the abyss with raw black metal fury, invoking primal darkness through blistering riffs and unholy incantations.

name: Warrior's Oath
bio: Warrior's Oath raises the banner of power metal high, celebrating tales of valor and glory with anthemic choruses and blazing guitar solos.

name: Chaos Engine
bio: Chaos Engine merges man and machine into a symphony of industrial metal, forging a dystopian landscape of pounding rhythms and mechanical mayhem.

name: Frozen Wasteland
bio: Frozen Wasteland journeys through icy realms with folk metal melodies, invoking the spirits of ancient warriors and mystical landscapes.

name: Apocalyptic Symphony
bio: Apocalyptic Symphony heralds the end times with symphonic power metal anthems, weaving tales of epic battles and heroic triumphs amidst the chaos of destruction.

name: Tempest Legion
bio: Tempest Legion charges into battle with relentless thrash metal aggression, delivering blistering riffs and lightning-fast solos that ignite mosh pits in a frenzy of chaos.

name: Necropolis
bio: Necropolis conjures haunting melodies and infernal fury with melodic black metal, delving into the shadows to unearth the darkest depths of the human psyche.

name: Ragnarok
bio: Ragnarok sails the seas of Norse mythology with thunderous viking metal anthems, invoking the spirits of ancient gods and heroes in a glorious epic of battle and triumph.

name: Serpentine Shadows
bio: Serpentine Shadows explores the depths of progressive black metal, weaving intricate compositions and atmospheric textures to create a mesmerizing sonic journey.

name: Ironclad Alliance
bio: Ironclad Alliance forges a bond of steel with classic heavy metal anthems, raising the banner of rebellion and freedom with powerful riffs and soaring vocals.

name: Eternal Descent
bio: Eternal Descent embarks on an odyssey of progressive metal exploration, pushing the boundaries of musical innovation with complex rhythms and ethereal melodies.

name: Hellfire Symphony
bio: Hellfire Symphony orchestrates a cacophony of infernal chaos with symphonic blackened death metal, summoning the flames of hell to consume all in their path.

name: Thunderstrike
bio: Thunderstrike ignites the stage with blistering speed metal fury, delivering lightning-fast riffs and thunderous rhythms that leave audiences breathless in their wake.

name: Witching Hour
bio: Witching Hour delves into the mysteries of the occult with dark and atmospheric metal, invoking ancient rituals and forbidden knowledge to awaken primal forces beyond human comprehension.

name: Astral Ascendancy
bio: Astral Ascendancy transcends mortal boundaries with progressive deathcore, fusing technical precision with brutal intensity to ascend to celestial heights of sonic mastery.

name: Savage Dominion
bio: Savage Dominion reigns supreme with crushing groove metal grooves, commanding audiences to headbang in unison to their primal rhythms and infectious hooks.

name: Forgotten Kingdom
bio: Forgotten Kingdom reigns over realms of sorrow with epic doom metal anthems, weaving tales of loss and redemption amidst thunderous riffs and mournful melodies.

name: Echoes of Eternity
bio: Echoes of Eternity paints vast sonic landscapes with progressive symphonic metal, melding intricate arrangements with orchestral grandeur to create a timeless musical journey.
